com.hazelcast.jet

Class RestartableException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • com.hazelcast.core.HazelcastException
            • com.hazelcast.jet.JetException
              • com.hazelcast.jet.RestartableException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class RestartableException
extends JetException
    Exception to throw from job-executing methods to indicate a failure that can be resolved by restarting the job.

    It is handled when thrown from:

    • Processor methods
    • lambda functions: key & timestamp extractors, map functions...
    • sources/sinks
    • init() method in Processor, ProcessorSupplier and ProcessorMetaSupplier (but not their close() methods)
    • ...
    If this exception is caught, the job will be terminated abruptly and restarted (if so configured).
    See Also:
